author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Owls Set to Compete in Texas at Red Raider Classic This Weekend
text:
Owls Set to Compete in Texas at Red Raider Classic This Weekend
By the Numbers
Florida Atlantic University's volleyball team is set to compete in the Red Raider Classic in Lubbock, Texas, marking their first road trip of the season. The Owls, having finished a strong homestand with a 3-1 record, will face Green Bay, Texas Tech, and Northern Arizona this weekend. Valeria Rosado leads the team in kills and earned an AAC Weekly Honorable Mention, while Victoria Hensley recently surpassed 2,000 career assists. The Owls aim to build on their solid start against opponents who are still finding their footing this season.
- Florida Atlantic is 3-1 this season, with three victories at home.
- Valeria Rosado has 40 kills, averaging 3.64 kills per set.
- Victoria Hensley has 10.14 assists per set and surpassed 2,000 career assists.
While Florida Atlantic has shown strong offensive capabilities, the team must navigate a more challenging environment on the road, which can impact performance. Additionally, opponents like Texas Tech and Northern Arizona have competitive records, suggesting they will provide a tough test for the Owls.State of Play
- Green Bay is 0-3 after a disappointing start to the season.
- Texas Tech enters with a 2-1 record and has shown moments of strong play.
- Northern Arizona has picked up two wins but suffered a loss in their recent match.
Following the Red Raider Classic, the Owls will compete in the Florida State Classic on September 13 and 14, indicating a busy schedule that will test their endurance and skill against diverse opponents.Bottom Line
The Owls need to maintain their momentum and build synergy as they transition to road games. Continued strong performances from key players like Rosado and Hensley will be essential for success against competitive rivals.
